alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kit Carson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 19 at 6:10AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 600 AM FRIDAY UNTIL 400 PM FRIDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...Sedgwick, Logan, Larimer, Weld, Morgan, Boulder, Broomfield, Washington, Adams, Denver, Arapahoe, Jefferson, Douglas, Elbert, Kit Carson, Lincoln, Cheyenne, El Paso and Phillips Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Julesburg, Sterling, Fort Collins, Greeley, Fort Morgan, Boulder, Broomfield, Akron, Brighton, Denver, Deer Trail, Littleton, Golden, Castle Rock, Kiowa, Burlington, Limon, Cheyenne Wells, Colorado Springs and Holyoke. WHEN...600 AM Friday May 19 to 400 PM Friday May 19 IMPACTS...Moderate to heavy smoke transported from Canadian wildfires will impact the advisory area through at least Friday afternoon. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
